content: a pointy top the gray hat had more decreases the brown hat had fewer example 104 / 12 = 8 66 or 104 / 13 = 8 i will want around 8 decreases in this example hat since dividing by 13 came out perfectly i ll decrease every 11 stitches the decrease takes up two stitches row 1 *ssk k11* until end of row row 2 knit row 3 *ssk k10* until end of row row 4 knit putting a marker before each decrease makes this step of the pattern wonderfully easy keep knitting this way alternating between row of decreases and row of plain knitting switch to dpn s when the hat gets too small stop when you have only a few stitches left then cut your yarn take the darning needle and thread your tail through the remaining stitches pull tight weave in ends and voila a custom made cabled viking hat hope you enjoyed the pattern knitter symbols fonts used courtesy knitter s magazine copyright © 1998 xrx increase © 2015 in2knition all rights reserved
